intro: Hieracium subcrassifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often lobed. Its flowers are yellow and clustered in flat-topped inflorescences, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium subcrassifolium is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
